meanings.definition: The state or quality of being windy.
meanings.sent1: The windinesses outside made it difficult to walk straight.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the windinesses blowing through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The excessive windinesses at the beach messed up my hair completely.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a strong windinesses, never-ending and swirling around.
meanings.sent5: The windinesses of the storm were so powerful, it knocked down trees.

meanings.definition: The presence of wind or air currents.
meanings.sent1: We could hear the windinesses howling outside our window.
meanings.sent2: The sailboat moved gracefully with the windinesses filling its sails.
meanings.sent3: The windinesses in the room made the curtains dance in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The windinesses of change swept through the town, bringing new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The windinesses of the desert carried sand grains far and wide.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be verbose or long-winded.
meanings.sent1: His windinesses during the speech bored the audience to sleep.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help her windinesses when telling stories to her friends.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's windinesses about grammar rules made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her windinesses in emails always made them longer than necessary.
meanings.sent5: The windinesses of his explanations confused everyone in the room.
